comment: Without a doubt the most rude professor I've ever dealt with. Writes emails back to project groups straight up mocking and disrespecting them. Only 3 tests and a group project make up your grade. His tests "come from the book" when in reality the questions on his tests don't relate to the text and can barely be read due to the language barrier.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor T is the goat. If you do bad its cause you prob didnt actually try
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: Professor T is passionate about marketing and a great teacher. He is helpful and direct about what is on the test. Anyone who did badly in his class probably did not read the book or go to class. He gives examples in class that are on the test. Super easy A if you aren't lazy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: Prof T was a difficult professor in regards to tests. They were very specific and would only come from lectures (him talking, not much on the PowerPoint). He does give bonus points on exams, a big group paper/presentation, and class participation. Will give out a few of the test questions and answers during lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor is very knowledgeable and really cares about marketing. His class is hard, but the workload is manageable. 3 tests and one group project. The tests were difficult but he grades on a curve and I passed the class with a B. This professor is the best you will find for the 3100 class if you are a marketing major or just need the credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Save yourself some headaches and don't take this professor. Seriously, if possible take anyone else that is available. Most ridiculous tests I have ever taken in my life. Only reason I got a B is because everyone failed and he had no choice but to curve our grades. If he is the only option then god help you. Good luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He responds to emails quickly, but he doesn't teach, he had us learn solely from reading the textbook. In the beginning he gave us practice quizzes, which were helpful, but then stopped giving them. We barely passed the IMC project because he didn't read ours fully. All of his feedback was incorrect, we did everything he asked. He is unorganized!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: You have 4 tests and 1 group project and when I tell you he is the rudest professor I've ever seen, believe it. The average on the first test was a B and then he told us he was changing the format basically because everyone did well.... The group project is a lot of work and he grades it harsh. Take someone else if you can! SO much reading, too!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Not technically savvy at all. Class went online due COVID-19 and he wasnt engaging. His lectures were a bit all over the place. You get a study guide for the exams based off in class lectures, however, youll need to read the textbook for material not covered in class. Exams cover 6-7 chapters at a time which could be a bit much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: His tests are based 60% on the book/slides, 40% on topics he only mentions in class. In order to pass you can't miss any class. He's technologically incapable of much more than sending an email. He's rude, and he won't help you calculate your grade or anything really. He has a lot of opinions, some that can be offensive. I don't recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This is the rudest Professor Ive ever had. During COVID-19, he was of NO help and expected students to try to figure out his materials without proper guidance. Before this, he was still rude and his tests were very hard. Hard enough for the straight A student to fail. Take him at your own risk.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Hope is hopeless as a teacher. His class is as stale as ever, reading directly off of PowerPoints, but he somehow makes his tests highly convoluted. The marketing project you have to do is not hard, but he gives awful feedback that only serves to call you a moron. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: The final in this class is very tough but he will replace that with your lowest test grade. Study the quiz he gave out during class and the PowerPoint then you should be fine on the tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Get ready to read

comment: Prof Torkornoo is very knowledgeable and experienced. His lectures are relevant to current issues and interesting. The class is difficult, you need to have a STRONG grasp on each concept. You must read the book (every word) and you HAVE TO go to class. I got a lot out of the class, but again, it was quite difficult.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is absolutely awful and not helpful at all. 4 tests and a group project worth just as much as a test. Problem is he doesnt know what feedback is. You get an optional midway check on the project for feedback. Hope youre excelling or else hell rudely criticize your work, say you didnt read & give absolutely no helpful advice
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Can barley understand him during lectures. 3 tests and a group project. Tests arent bad if you buy the connect. But he gives NO help on the group project giving no feedback and picks apart presentations without any real evidence why.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Try to take a different professor if you can and I do really mean it!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: As an Intro to Marketing class that most business students have to take, I dont recommend taking him. 5 chapters on each test (which are only two weeks apart) which you wont learn in class because he rants about his personal life and experieces instead of actually teaching the course. Going to class is useless, buy the text book and read it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Tests come straight from textbook no reason to go to class unless you want to hear him brag about his master's students. He is mean and gives god awful feedback regarding your HUGE marketing project. I cannot stand him and skipped every single class except for the tests and project presentations. I got a B by doing this. Final replaces worst test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor I've taken! DO NOT TAKE HIM IN THE SUMMER! He crams 5 months of work into 2 and it's hard. 50 question tests with 7 chapters in them, A-E choices! He's very diffucult when it comes to answering a straight question. Gives a marketing project that's just over the top. Lectures are BORING the house, esp. since he's doing it for 3 hours
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a solid professor! Definitely not an easy class by any means but he gives you all the tools needed to do well. Grades the group project for each individual depending on how hard they worked on the project, which was awesome because it prevented slackers. 5 tests and an optional final. Read the textbook and try not to skip and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: It is clear Professor Torkornoo cares about his students success, he gives great lectures and his tests match up with what he says in class. The textbook will be needed if you want an A, but if you're just looking to pass you should be fine without it. Four exams and one group project is all the grades you'll be getting this class. Optional final.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Took him for Fall 2018. tests are hard conceptual, the attendance is not mandatory but its better to go to class because he tells you what will come in the tests. there are 4 exams, and only 1 marketing plan project. However in order to pass one must read the book. IF you dnt read the book you will fail the exam. Final is optional
Study the book and do the work and you should get an A. He gives powerpoints and posts them on D2L after class. Not an easy A but definitely attainable
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Pay close attention to his instructions for the presentations; use 3+ concepts. Study key terms and lecture notes. Like he says, read the book. Tests are not as bad as people say if you put in a little work on the front end. He loves interacting with his students and is a great professor.

Hope, is a man, didn't realize it until the first day. His tests are not bad, I would study all night and the morning of and get a 88-92.  Ended with a B, only class I got a B in.  No need for going to class except for weekly presentations, which are two paragraphs you read from your seat.  Easy presentations, use 3 concepts not 2, you'll do better
I took this class during the 8 week period. I did not put much effort and received a B. Participation and following a long with notes are essential to passing the class.

It does not matter how much you pay attention, and it does not matter how much you read the book, his tests are so backwards and convoluted it is impossible to understand what they are asking. Put full effort in and got a B, only because I "participated" multiple times per day.

He's a very nice guy, funny and knowledgable.  Tests are worded very strangely and can be ambiguous.  This is one of those classes that should be an A if you work for it, but I found it very hard.  Group presentations were easy, but he gave no clear directions.  Class participation is worth an exam grade; will count your comments and assign a grade

He is a very interesting teacher and does his best to keep the class engaged. The participation is easy and interesting. Participation is a big part of the grade and the tests are very hard because of how the questions are asked.

Worst professor I have ever had. I do not mind working hard to get an A, but he has made it impossible. He changes how he wants things presented every class period, but does not clarify it,  and if it is presented wrong he takes away half credit. His tests are extremely hard. You must attend class and take detailed notes to pass.

He's a passionate professor who knows a lot and explains things well. His tests are challenging, but fair and he assigns a large group project that you really learn a lot from. Put effort into this class, and you will get a lot out of it. If you try to coast, it will be very difficult.

Professor Hope was so helpful and willing to clarify when needed. He was very precise as to what his expectations for the group project were. Tests were a bit tricky, but if you read the book & listen to his lectures, it's doable. First test I barely read the book & made an 84, then for the next tests, I read & made 98 & 96! Exempted the final.

Some of the things I learned in this class helped me get my first career job because they asked things that pertained to this.  If you want an easy 'A', go somewhere else.  If you want an 'A' or 'B' and are willing to work hard but learn something that is usable in the real world, take this class!

He loves student interaction and gets all hurt when no one talks. Just talk to make him happy. The first test I got an A and the second test I got a D and the third test I got a B. The group project is just a group paper. He is from Africa so his test questions dont always make sense. Just ask him to clarify what he wants.
Unstructured lectures, hard to understand. He jumps from one topic to another, not consistent.
He is a horrible teacher. Each test includes 1/3 of the book and lectures are pointless. Very hard tests, with trick questions.

Mr T is a nice person but his test are hard a tricky. Took him during the summer.He likes to talk and likes lots of interaction with students. So if you dont want to talk sit in the back. A group project and 3 tests over alot of material. Remember those test are hard.

Had him a few years ago for Strategic Marketing.  Good prof.  Pay attention in class and do the work.  He also leads the travel abroad classes.  Many students like him a great deal.  Read the book.  He could grade a little harder, though.
